intro: Sisymbrium canescens, commonly known as hoary tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy, grayish-green leaves and small yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and roadsides. Sisymbrium canescens is an annual herb that produces small, round pods containing several seeds.
